text: Presidential elections were held in Peru in 1919. Augusto B. Leguía was elected with 62% of the vote.Fernando Tuesta Soldevilla (2001) Perú politítico en cifras, Friedrich Ebert Stiftung, p609 ==Results== {| class=wikitable style=text-align:right !Candidate !Votes !% |- |align=left|Augusto B. Leguía||122,736||62.34 |- |align=left|Ántero Apíllaga||64,936||32.98 |- |align=left|Carlos Bernales||6,038||3.07 |- |align=left|Isaías de Piérola||3,167||1.61 |- |align=left|Total||196,877||100 |- |align=left colspan=3|Source: Tuesta |} ==References== 1919 Category:1919 elections in South America Category:1919 in Peru 1919
title: 1919 Peruvian presidential election
